sources.title: Identity Unknown
sources.description: A soldier (Richard Arlen) who survived a bombing in which three others, who were burned beyond recognition but who possessed similar physical descriptions, perished. Hospitalized, and suffering from amnesia as a result, he adopts the name of "Johnny March" and sets out to visit the locales where service records indicated the four victims lived in hopes of establishing his identity.

sources.title: Identity Unknown (1945) RICHARD ARLEN â™¥ CHERYL WALKER
sources.description:
Stars: Richard Arlen, Cheryl Walker, Bobby Driscoll
 Director: Walter Colmes

 A soldier survives a bombing in which his three fellow soldiers are killed. When he recovers he discovers he has amnesia, and since his companions' bodies were burned beyond recognition, the army doesn't know which one of the four he is. He goes AWOL and searches out the families of the three dead soldiers, hoping to find out his own identity.

sources.title: Identity Unknown (1945) Drama, War | Full Length Movie
sources.description:
HAVE I THE RIGHT TO LOVE? An amnesiac soldier, the the only survivor of a group of four unidentified soldiers, victims of a bomb raid, visits each man's addresses with the hope of restoring his memory and identity.
 
Director: Walter Colmes
Writer: Richard Weil 
Stars: Richard Arlen, Cheryl Walker, Roger Pryor 
Genres: Drama,War
